body:
Comment 4 by **leimy2k**: 
I take back my previous comment (deleted), that that wouldn't work for partial data.

One could just define the type they're unmarshalling to the minimum acceptable size, and
then the sizes of what's returned will not matter so much.

Basically just use the smallest atomically acceptable types, and I should be ok.  

That does mean I can't really create a buffer of 100 of these and have the function tell
me how many I successfully read.

The problem with this API is it doesn't plan for failure, and therefore can't be very
helpful in a situation that must be tolerant to faults.  It's a workable problem at a
higher level though.
